Key Match Events: Kyle Hendricks pitched 7 1/3 innings, allowing only two singles and two walks, with 11 strikeouts in a row in one stretch.
Post-Match Reflections: Kyle Hendricks expressed his emotions about the game, stating, 'You feel all the emotions, man, feel so lucky. I'm so happy. I had my whole family here today up in the stands.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game may have been Kyle Hendricks's final start for the Cubs, as he can become a free agent after completing a contract worth $70 million over five seasons.
Others: Isaac Paredes and Pete Crow-Armstrong had run-scoring singles in a three-run eighth inning, contributing to the Cubs' 3-0 win over the Reds. Tyson Milller (5-1) got two outs in the eighth, and Porter Hodge pitched a perfect ninth for his ninth save in 12 chances, finishing a three-hitter.
